title: Statistic Variability (Spread)

metadata.description: Learn about Statistic Variability (Spread) with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Descriptive Statistics
is broken down into
Tendency
and
Variability
.
Variability
uses these measures:
Min and Max
Variance
Deviation
Distribution
Skewness
Kurtosis
The Variance
In statistics, the
Variance
is the average of the squared differences from the
Mean Value
.
In other words, the variance describes how far a set of numbers is
Spread Out
from the mean (average) value.
Mean value is described in the 
This table contains 11 values:
7
8
8
9
9
9
10
11
14
14
15
Calculate the Variance:
// Calculate the Mean (m)
let m = (7+8+8+9+9+9+10+11+14+14+15)/11;
// Calculate the Sum of Squares (ss)
let ss = (7-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (10-m)**2 + (11-m)**2 + (14-m)**2 + (15-m)**2;
// Calculate the Variance
let variance = ss / 11;

Or use a math library like
math.js
:
const values = [7,8,8,9,9,9,10,11,14,14,15];
let variance = math.variance(values, "uncorrected");

Standard Deviation
Standard Deviation
is a measure of how spread out numbers are.
The symbol is
σ
(Greek letter sigma).
The formula is the
√
variance (the square root of the variance).
The Standard Deviation is (in JavaScript):
// Calculate the Mean (m)
let m = (7+8+8+9+9+9+10+11+14+15)/11;
// Calculate the Sum of Squares (ss)
let ss = (7-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (8-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (9-m)**2 + (10-m)**2 + (11-m)**2 + (14-m)**2 + (15-m)**2;
// Calculate the Variance
let variance = ss / 11;
// Calculate the Standard Deviation
let std = Math.sqrt(variance);

Deviation
is a measure of
Distance
.
How far
(on average), all values are from
the Mean
(the Middle).
Or if you use a math library like
math.js
:
const values = [7,8,8,9,9,9,9,10,11,14,15];
let std = math.std(values, "uncorrected");

★
+1

options:
broken down into
Tendency
and
Variability

the average of the squared differences from the
Mean Value

Tendency
and
Variability'.

summary: This tutorial covers Statistic Variability (Spread) concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Statistic Variability (Spread) effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Statistic Variability (Spread) and how to apply it in your projects.
